availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warren Daniel Crandall (Madison County, Illinois, farmhand and first lieutenant (U.S. Army))

body.p: Madison County, Illinois, farmhand and first lieutenant (U.S. Army). New York native. Son of Daniel Crandall and Susannah Rowe Crandall. Married to Georgia M. Nance Crandall in St. Louis, Missouri, on October 8, 1863. Father of Minnie Crandall. Farmhand in Madison County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 59th Illinois Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from August 7, 1861, to November 5, 1862. Served in the Mississippi Marine Brigade (U.S.A.) as captain and assistant adjutant general from November 1862, to August 1864. Resigned from service on December 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Madison County, Township 4, p. 708.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Linn County, Brookfield, St. Catharine, p. 258A.
Francis B. Heitman, Historical register and dictionary of the United States Army,
from its organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903, Vol. 1 (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1903), 335.
The History of Linn County, Missouri: An Encyclopedia of Useful Information, and a Compendium of Actual Facts (Kansas City, Mo.: Birdsall & Dean, 1882), 535-36.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Missouri, Application #1053239, Certificate #718345.
Missouri Death Certificates, Missouri Secretary of State, https://www.sos.mo.gov/images/archives/deathcerts/1919/191900022278.PDF (accessed December 22, 2020).
_Find A Grave, "Warren Daniel Crandall (1838-1919)," Memorial #44006268, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44006268 (accessed December 22, 2020).
